title: Fundamentals of Wireless Network Latency Management: Understanding Machine Learning-Based Solutions

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental internet and network concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, focusing on case-based education applicable to real-life contexts.

learning_goals: Students can explain at least three causes of latency in wireless networks (e.g., bufferbloat).
Students can describe the operational principles of the machine learning-based dynamic buffer management technique (LearnQueue) step-by-step.
Students can apply at least two delay optimization strategies in real network scenarios and analyze simulation results.
Students can compare buffer adjustment strategies based on diverse application requirements (gaming, voice calls, safety systems).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
